skill.name: backlink-analyzer
skill.description: Analyzes backlink profiles to understand link authority, identify toxic links, discover link building opportunities, and monitor competitor link acquisition. Essential for off-page SEO strategy.
skill.summary: Comprehensive SEO backlink analysis tool for profile auditing, toxic link detection, and competitor link gap analysis.
skill.author: aaron-he-zhu

security_audit.summary: Static analysis detected 78 potential security issues across 3 files (1468 lines). After comprehensive evaluation, all findings are confirmed false positives. The detected patterns are markdown code blocks showing example commands, documentation URLs, SEO metric abbreviations (DR/DA), and relative file path references in documentation. This is a legitimate SEO analysis skill with no executable code, making it safe for marketplace publication.

low_findings.title: Markdown Code Blocks Flagged as External Commands
low_findings.description: Static scanner flagged 32 instances of Ruby/shell backtick execution patterns. These are markdown code block delimiters (```) used for formatting documentation examples, not actual code execution. Found in SKILL.md and reference documentation showing bash command examples and email templates.
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: Clear evidence that backticks are markdown code block delimiters surrounding documentation examples, not executable code

low_findings.title: Documentation URLs Flagged as Network Calls
low_findings.description: Static scanner flagged 3 instances of hardcoded URLs as network security risks. These are example URLs in markdown documentation (e.g., spam-site.com in disavow file examples) and relative file path references, not actual network requests.
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: URLs appear in markdown documentation as examples within code blocks, not as executable network calls

low_findings.title: Relative File Paths Flagged as Path Traversal
low_findings.description: Static scanner flagged 12 instances of path traversal sequences (../). These are relative file path references in markdown documentation linking to other skill files (e.g., ../../CONNECTORS.md), not malicious path traversal attacks.
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: Parent directory references are standard markdown link syntax for documentation navigation, not exploit attempts

content.value_statement: Struggling to understand why your rankings stagnate despite content efforts? This skill provides comprehensive backlink profile analysis, identifies toxic links that may penalize your site, and reveals competitor link building opportunities you are missing.
actual_capabilities: Analyze complete backlink profiles with authority metrics (Domain Authority, Domain Rating)
Detect toxic and harmful links using quality scoring rubrics
Identify link building opportunities through competitor intersection analysis
Generate disavow file recommendations for Google Search Console
Track link velocity and monitor new or lost links over time
Evaluate anchor text distribution and link type ratios
limitations: Requires backlink data from external SEO tools or user-provided CSV exports
Cannot directly access Google Search Console or third-party backlink databases
Analysis quality depends on accuracy of input data from SEO tools
Does not automatically submit disavow files to Google

use_cases.title: SEO Professional Audit
use_cases.description: Comprehensive backlink profile audit for client websites to identify toxic links, assess overall link health, and generate disavow recommendations.

use_cases.title: Competitor Link Gap Analysis
use_cases.description: Discover which domains link to competitors but not to your site, prioritized by authority and relevance to identify high-value link building targets.

use_cases.title: Link Profile Health Monitoring
use_cases.description: Regular monitoring of backlink acquisition velocity, new link quality assessment, and identification of potentially harmful links from negative SEO attacks.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Backlink Profile Overview
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the backlink profile for my domain [domain-name.com] and provide an overview of key metrics including total backlinks, referring domains, and domain authority.
prompt_templates.scenario: Quick health check of your backlink profile

prompt_templates.title: Toxic Link Detection
prompt_templates.prompt: Check for toxic backlinks on [domain-name.com] and identify any high-risk links that should be disavowed. Include risk scores and recommendations.
prompt_templates.scenario: Identifying potentially harmful links that could cause penalties

prompt_templates.title: Competitor Link Gap Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Find link building opportunities by analyzing [competitor1.com], [competitor2.com], and [competitor3.com]. Show me which domains link to them but not to my site.
prompt_templates.scenario: Discovering new link building prospects from competitor backlinks

prompt_templates.title: Comprehensive Backlink Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a complete backlink analysis for [domain-name.com] including profile overview, link quality assessment, toxic link detection, and recommendations for improvement. Compare against industry benchmarks.
prompt_templates.scenario: Full professional audit with actionable insights

output_examples.input: Check for toxic backlinks on example.com
output_examples.output: Detected 12 high-risk links requiring disavowal. Primary risks include 5 links from suspected PBN networks (DR 15-25), 4 from foreign language spam directories, and 3 sitewide footer links from unrelated sites. Recommended action: Submit disavow file for 3 domains, request removal of 2 individual URLs.

output_examples.input: Find link building opportunities by analyzing competitor-a.com and competitor-b.com
output_examples.output: Identified 47 domains linking to competitors but not to you. Top 10 priority opportunities include g2.com (DR 91, links to both competitors), entrepreneur.com (DR 92), and capterra.com (DR 89). Estimated impact: acquiring links from top 10 could add 10-15 high-authority referring domains.

Profile Health Score: 72/100. Strengths: Strong referring domain growth (+18 in 30 days), healthy anchor text distribution (brand anchors 38%), good topical relevance (68%). Concerns: Dofollow ratio slightly elevated at 85%, 6% toxic links above 5% threshold.

best_practices: Provide backlink data from reputable SEO tools (Ahrefs, SEMrush, Moz) or CSV exports with complete domain and authority metrics
Run analysis quarterly to monitor link profile health and catch toxic links early before they impact rankings
Combine with domain-authority-auditor skill for complete SEO scoring across citation, trust, and expertise dimensions
anti_patterns: Do not disavow low-quality links that are merely weak (DR <20) rather than toxic, as this may unnecessarily reduce your link profile
Avoid acquiring links too rapidly after analysis - natural link velocity appears more organic to search engines
Do not focus exclusively on high-DR domains while ignoring topical relevance, as relevant mid-tier links often provide more ranking value

faq.question: What backlink data sources work with this skill?
faq.answer: This skill accepts backlink data from major SEO tools (Ahrefs, SEMrush, Moz, Majestic) via CSV export, or manually provided data including referring domains, anchor text, and authority metrics.

faq.question: How often should I analyze my backlink profile?
faq.answer: Run comprehensive analysis quarterly for routine monitoring. Perform additional analysis after major link building campaigns, if you notice ranking drops, or when launching new products that attract attention.

faq.question: What is a toxic link and when should I disavow it?
faq.answer: Toxic links are from spammy domains, private blog networks (PBNs), or link farms that can trigger Google penalties. Disavow only when you have clear evidence of manipulation risk. Low-quality links are not necessarily toxic.

faq.question: Can this skill automatically submit disavow files to Google?
faq.answer: No. This skill generates disavow file recommendations in the correct text format, but you must manually upload the file to Google Search Console. This ensures you review all disavow decisions.

faq.question: What is link intersection analysis?
faq.answer: Link intersection identifies domains that link to multiple competitors but not to your site. These represent high-value opportunities because the domains have demonstrated willingness to link to content in your niche.

faq.question: What are healthy benchmarks for a backlink profile?
faq.answer: Healthy profiles typically have 60-80% dofollow links, less than 15% exact match anchor text, 25-45% brand anchors, under 5% toxic links, and positive steady growth in referring domains.
